question: Which British officer suppressed the Revolt of 1857 in Delhi?
explanation: The last Mughal emperor, Bahadur Shah Zafar led the Revolt of 1857 in Delhi, though the real control was exercised by General Bakht Khan. On the side of the British the combined effort of Nicholson, Wilson, Baird Smith and Neville Chamberlain enabled the recapture Delhi by September 1857. In Later, Bahadur Shah II was arrested and deported to Rangoon, where he remained in exile till he died in 1862.
